text:
So if you don't have Ops Hub this link doesn't work correct? If not could someone clarify the programming language / method used for custom code that can be created for internal workflows / process automation via Ops Hub? I checked for documentation online and only found info on HubL syntax which appears to be related to CMS and not sure if this is what is used for Ops Hub? If not can someone point me to some online resources for myself and my developers to learn more about Ops Hub? Thank you!

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl>

Right, this is exclusively a feature on the Format Data action (not custom code action) and even though under the hood it uses HubL, the customer facing syntax is more simple than that and resembles the Google Sheets or Excel language
If you want to use the custom code action in Ops Hub, you would be writing Node.js
Dang Zeke, I was writing both of those and you beat me to it
FYI format data and custom code actions need an enterprise version of ops hub
Cool so there are limitations with professional / starter versions? Is it pretty common that most people need enterprise to really use custom code effectively?
Yeah HubSpot has put more advance features like webhooks, custom code actions, and format data into the enterprise version
